isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CATERPILLAR - 1992 - 1993 - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - IDLE SHUTDOWN TIMER SYSTEM

svcprocinfo.para: The idle shutdown timer can be programmed to shut down the engine after the engine has remained at idle RPM for a customer selected time period (3 to 60 minutes). To activate the Idle Shutdown Timer, the following conditions must be met:

item.para: The customer must have selected this feature. The default selection is OFF. The customer must also choose the allowed amount of IDLE TIME before shutdown.
The ECM must not detect any vehicle speed (no signal from Vehicle Speed Sensor).
The Parking Brake must be applied.
The throttle must be in IDLE position.
The engine must be at operating temperature.

svcprocinfo.para: After the park brake is engaged, the Idle Shutdown feature begins to count down the selected time period. The engine can be idling at low idle or at an idle RPM selected by the PTO governor. Ninety seconds before the programmed shutdown time is reached, the ENGINE WARNING LIGHT begins to flash rapidly.

To override the idle timer shutdown feature, the service brake or clutch pedal must be moved during the 90 seconds when the ENGINE WARNING LIGHT is flashing. This allows the engine to be idled for extensive periods.

Failure to move the service brake or clutch pedal while the ENGINE WARNING LIGHT is flashing allows the engine to shut down at the programmed time. The Idle Shutdown will only shut down the engine and NOT the electrical system of the vehicle.
Movement of the Throttle Pedal OR releasing the Park Brake at any time automatically resets the idle shutdown timer feature.

important.para: The ECM monitors system activity and records two events: (1) when the idle shutdown timer is activated and shuts down the engine, and (2) when the idle shutdown timer is activated, but is overridden before actual shutdown. These events are electronically recorded for informational purposes. These are informational codes, not fault codes and do not require service.

svcsubproc.title: Park Brake Switch (300)
svcsubproc.para: The purpose of the park brake switch is to enable (turn on) the shutdown timer. The Park Brake switch is CLOSED with the park brake applied and OPEN when the park brake is released.

Park Brake Switch circuit (97E) is an input to the ECM through OEM connector (191) terminal 11. The ground side of the Park Brake switch is connected through circuit 97-GR to OEM connector (191) terminal 2. With the park brake released (switch open), the ECM sees 5 volts at OEM connector (191) terminal 11. Applying the brakes closes the switch, and the ECM sees 0 volts at terminal 11.
